bioghist.p: Bernard M. Taylor (1906-2003) was born in Tallapoosa, Georgia. He completed his high school education in West Philadelphia and graduated from Lafayette College in 1928. Taylor entered Union Theological Seminary in New York and completed his studies there in 1931. In that same year he married Anne Justice, of Spartanburg, South Carolina, who was also at Union Seminary. Taylor was ordained in 1931 and was immediately installed as pastor of the Olive Church, Clarion Presbytery, in Oliveburg, Pennsylvania. In 1936, he accepted a call by Christ Church in Alpine, Tennessee. He also served as Stated Clerk of Cumberland Mountain Presbytery, Synod of the Mid-South, from 1942 to 1951. The Taylors took a leave of absence in 1946 and returned to New York City where both earned Master's Degrees in Christian Education from the Union Theological Seminary and Columbia University. They returned to Alpine the following year and served there until 1952 when they were called by Old Rehoboth Church (Maryland). Bernard Taylor served as pastor of that congregation and as the Stated Supply for the Gunby Church in Stockton, Maryland for five years. In 1957, he received a call from the Georgetown and Coolspring Presbyterian Churches, and served as the Moderator of New Castle Presbytery for one year. Bernard Taylor was installed as Associate Pastor of the First and Central Presbyterian Church in Wilmington, Delaware, in 1962 and remained there until his retirement in 1976.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers related to the Alpine Institute, Alpine Rural Life Center, and Christ Church Presbyterian Church in Alpine. Materials include: correspondence; typed histories and memoirs; printed material; newsletters; church bulletins; photographs; slides; newspaper clippings; an audiocassette of a recognition service for Bernard M. Taylor (1976); index cards of "contacts," including members of the church in Alpine; a video made for Overtown County cable access television about Alpine (1986); Bernard Taylor's diaries, 1935-1941; a copy of Taylor's biography The Roadmaker; a photocopy of "A Parson and Partner for All Seasons," a memoir by the Taylors; some materials related to Taylor's pastorate of Old Rehoboth Church, Maryland; Christ Church parish records (1943-1944); a small amount of financial records; leases and contracts related to property of Alpine; and maps.
